verb.description: Gratify or indulge (an immoral or distasteful desire, need, or habit or a person with such a desire, etc.)
examples: newspapers are pandering to people's baser instincts

origin: Late Middle English (as a noun): from Pandare, the name of a character in Chaucer's Troilus and Criseyde (see Pandarus). The verb dates from the early 17th century.
